holidays.name: World Mental Health Day
holidays.description: A day dedicated to raising awareness and mobilizing efforts in support of mental health. It promotes mental well-being and encourages conversations around mental illness.
holidays.origin: Established in 1992 by the World Federation for Mental Health to focus global attention on mental health issues.
holidays.funFact: Each year, a different theme is selected to highlight critical mental health topics, fostering worldwide dialogues.

holidays.name: National Angel Food Cake Day
holidays.description: Celebrate the light and fluffy delight known as angel food cake, a heavenly treat known for its airy texture and simple ingredients.
holidays.origin: An unofficial food holiday honoring this classic American dessert, popularized in the 19th century.
holidays.funFact: Angel food cake requires no fat or egg yolks and rises solely by the air whipped into egg whites, making it surprisingly delightful and low-fat!

holidays.name: World Homeless Day
holidays.description: A day designed to bring awareness to the plight of homeless individuals worldwide, encouraging community support and policy changes.
holidays.origin: Initiated in 2010 to complement the United Nations' goals to end homelessness globally.
holidays.funFact: Events around the world include clothing drives, soup kitchens, and storytelling to humanize the homeless experience.

holidays.name: Emergency Nurse Day
holidays.description: A day to honor the hardworking emergency nurses who provide critical care in high-stress, fast-paced environments.
holidays.origin: Observed by nursing communities to recognize and celebrate these vital healthcare professionals.
holidays.funFact: Emergency nurses often juggle trauma cases, sudden illnesses, and crisis situations all in one shift, making them medical superheroes!
